1.text: Flies of death will cause the oil of the perfume to stink, it will ferment: the preciousness of wisdom above the honor of the least folly.

2.text: The heart of the wise one to his right, and the heart of the foolish one to his left.

3.text: And also as the foolish one went in the way, his heart was wanting, and he said to all, It is folly.

4.text: If the spirit of him ruling shall go up against thee, thou shalt not leave thy place; for quietness will put down great sins.

5.text: There is an evil I saw under the sun as an error going forth from before him having power:

6.text: Folly was given to great heights, and the rich were set in lowness.

7.text: I saw servants upon horses, and chiefs going as servants upon the earth.

8.text: He digging a ditch shall fall into it; he breaking down a wall, a serpent shall bite him.

9.text: He removing stones; shall suffer pain by them; and he cleaving woods asunder shall be endangered by them.

10.text: If the iron became dull and he polished not the face, and he will strengthen the forces: and wisdom will make preeminence to prosper.

11.text: If a serpent will bite without magic; and no preeminence to the possessor of the tongue.

12.text: The words of the wise oneâ€™s mouth, grace; and the lips of the foolish one shall swallow him down.

13.text: The beginning of the words of his mouth, folly: and the latter state of his mouth the folly of evil.

14.text: And the foolish one will multiply words: man shall not know what shall be; and what shall be after him, who shall announce to him?

15.text: The labor of the foolish will weary them, because he knew not to go to the city.

16.text: Wo! to thee, O land: thy king a youth, and thy chiefs will eat in the morning.

17.text: Happy thou, O land: thy king the son of nobles, and thy chiefs shall eat in time, in strength and not in drinking.

18.text: By sloth the frame work will pine away; and by the letting down of the hands, the house will drop.

19.text: For laughter they make bread, and wine will gladden the living: and silver will answer with all.

20.text: Thou shalt not curse the king in thy consciousness, and in thy bed-chamber thou shalt not curse the rich for the bird of the heavens will bring the voice, and the possessor of wings shall announce the word.
